oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of an American soldier with a black bear cub
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph shows an unidentified American soldier with a black bear cub on a leash. The photograph was most likely taken at Camp Sevier, South Carolina, the assembly point for the National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas that would compose the 30th Division. The Still Image is one of a large collection which belonged to Sgt. Ernest West, Batry. B, 114th F.A. Regt., 30th Div. West was from the Chattanooga area as was most of Batry. B.
